title: Dance In The Skies
opening: The unthinkable has come to pass. Sigurd is now a traitor in the eyes of his beloved Grannvale. In desperation, his army flees to find refuge in the northern Kingdom of Silesse.

Silesse was founded by the Wind Crusader, Ced. It lies under the watchful guard of the valiant pegasus knights and wind mages, and so for over a century since its foundation, Silesse has maintained itself as a neutral nation and persistent all invaders.

However, ever since the death of its king several years ago, the royal family has been plagued with strife over its inheritance, and shades of war creep over the peaceful land. The late king and his wife, Queen Rahna, had a single son, Prince Lewyn. The king's greedy younger brother, Duke Daccar, objects to Lewyn being heir to the throne and has confined himself to Zaxon Castle in protest. As if acting in concert, the king's youngest brother, Duke Maios, has set to work raising an army for himself at Thove Castle.

Out of disgust at his uncles, Prince Lewyn left Silesse to travel the world years ago. Is there no end to the dukes' avarice? Their lust for power will condemn Silesse, a beautiful and majestic land, to the searing ravages of a brutal war.

intro.speaker: Oifey
intro.line: Sire, Queen Rahna is here to see you.

intro.speaker: Sigurd
intro.line: Queen Rahna?

intro.speaker: Rahna
intro.line: Good evening, Lord Sigurd. Are you comfortable settling into Sailane yet? Is there anything at all that you need?

intro.speaker: Sigurd
intro.line: As much as I appreciate the offer, we're fine. I can't thank you enough for your hospitality, Your Highness.

intro.speaker: Rahna
intro.line: I know Sailane is perhaps too small to house all of you adequately, and I'm sorry, but please, bear with me for a while longer... I'm doing all I can to hasten your liberty. I've sent letter after letter to Belhalla to advocate for your innocence. As of yet, however, I've still heard nothing at all from King Azmur.

intro.speaker: Sigurd
intro.line: This... This has to be Reptor's doing! First he betrays my father, and now he's stopping all of your letters! He must be!

intro.speaker: Rahna
intro.line: Calm yourself, Lord Sigurd! I know well the pain you're feeling, but you cannot let your grudges rule you. Your anger will not save your father. Hatred will only destroy you from within. I swear to you, I can and I will find a way to set this to rights, but you must be patient.

intro.speaker: Sigurd
intro.line: You're right... I'm sorry, Your Highness. I really appreciate all you've done for me.

intro.speaker: Rahna
intro.line: It's alright, Lord Sigurd. Oh, before I forget... There actually has been some good news from Grannvale of late.

intro.speaker: Sigurd
intro.line: Good news, you say?

intro.speaker: Rahna
intro.line: Mm. A previously unknown daughter of Prince Kurth has been discovered. All of Grannvale is rejoicing at the news.

intro.speaker: Sigurd
intro.line: Huh?! Is that even possible?

intro.speaker: Rahna
intro.line: It took King Azmur only a glance to recognize her true heritage. She bears the brand of Naga, the proof of a true heir to House Belhalla. There is no doubt. She is Kurth's child.

intro.speaker: Sigurd
intro.line: I see... Thank goodness. At the very least, this means the royal lineage won't go extinct.

intro.speaker: Rahna
intro.line: That's not all. The princess and Duke Arvis are in a relationship. King Azmur has given his blessing, and a magnificent wedding will soon be held.

intro.speaker: Sigurd
intro.line: Arvis? Really?

intro.speaker: Rahna
intro.line: All who've seen the happy couple eagerly attest that this beautiful princess and Duke Arvis are perfectly matched together. To say nothing of how happy the couple is said to be! Young love is wonderful, isn't it? ...Oh. Lord Sigurd, I'm so sorry. I forgot. Your wife is still-

intro.speaker: Sigurd
intro.line: Deirdre... My wife's still gone, yes... It's been over a year since she vanished. She's missed an entire year of watching Seliph grow up.

intro.speaker: Rahna
intro.line: I'm so sorry, Lord Sigurd, but cheer up. I know you'll reunite someday.

intro.speaker: Sigurd
intro.line: You're right. I feel it, too. I can't give in to sorry just yet. I can't give up on finding her.

intro.speaker: Annand
intro.line: Pardon me, milady, but the hour is late. We should be on our way soon.

intro.speaker: Rahna
intro.line: Ah, of course. I'll be with you in a moment. Lord Sigurd, one last thing... Beware of Duke Maios of Thove. I regret to say that my brother-in-law has long hungered to claim Sailane for himself. It's only a matter of time till he goes so far as to attack you. I wish I could provide you with reinforcements, but...

intro.speaker: Sigurd
intro.line: ...I know. The capital is under the very same threat from Duke Daccar of Zaxon. You cannot afford to weaken your own guard. Daccar will pounce upon you given even a hint of weakness. Don't worry about it, Your Highness. There's nothing the Thove army can throw at us that we can't handle.

intro.speaker: Rahna
intro.line: Ah, of course. I should be more confident in such veteran heroes as yourselves. Oh! I've been talking for so long, I lost track of the time. Take care, Lord Sigurd.

intro.speaker: Sigurd
intro.line: You, too, Your Highness. Thank you.

intro.speaker: Lewyn
intro.line: Mother! Aren't you forgetting somebody? You've just chatted for hours and hours with Sigurd, yet you can't even acknowledge your own son?

intro.speaker: Rahna
intro.line: My son? The one who abandoned me two years ago, going gods know where? How do I talk to someone who's clearly not here?

intro.speaker: Lewyn
intro.line: Heh heh... So this is how it's going to be, is it? You're still mad at me, then?

intro.speaker: Rahna
intro.line: Of course I am! Do you have any idea how hard it was without you, and how worried I've been after you? That my own son could be so cold-hearted... I thought I knew you better than this.

intro.speaker: Lewyn
intro.line: Look, I know you're upset, but I had my reasons for all this. But come on, I'm home safely! Surely that counts for something and you can forgive me? I swear I'll make up for it and be the very picture of a good son. Hey, how about I give you a shoulder massage to start?

intro.speaker: Rahna
intro.line: Oh! What nerve! Treating me as if I'm an old crone... Look, Lewyn, there are more pressing matters which we need to talk about, and soon. Come to Silesse as soon as possible. Do not forget! Do I make myself clear?

intro.speaker: Lewyn
intro.line: ...Sigh. I thought she'd never stop.

intro.speaker: Annand
intro.line: Don't be fooled by your mother's outward behavior, milord. She's actually very happy, now you've returned. Indeed, she hasn't been anything as cheerful as this since before you left.

intro.speaker: Lewyn
intro.line: Thanks, Annand. Knowing you're at her side is a big relief. Look after her, okay?

intro.speaker: Annand
intro.line: Yes, sir! Rest assured, I will protect the queen with my life, on my honor as the captain of the Silessian pegasus knights.

intro.speaker: Lewyn
intro.line: Thanks. Oh, one more thing... Are you gonna leave Erinys here with Sigurd?

intro.speaker: Annand
intro.line: I am... Milord, I'd like you to keep my sister at your side. She-

intro.speaker: Erinys
intro.line: Annand!

intro.speaker: Annand
intro.line: Oh. Eavesdropping, were you, Erinys?

intro.speaker: Erinys
intro.line: You were about to tell him too much, so...

intro.speaker: Annand
intro.line: Ah. My apologies, Erinys. There are things he shouldn't know just yet, of course... Erinys, I'll be leaving with Queen Rahna and returning to Silesse Castle shortly. You'll stay here and keep and eye on Prince Lewyn. Best of luck.

intro.speaker: Erinys
intro.line: Thank you, Annand.

intro.speaker: Quan
intro.line: Sigurd, we'll now be taking our leave. It's high time we returned to Leonster. Rest assured, we'll be back, this time leading the full military might of Leonster to your aid. May that day come soon, my friend.

intro.speaker: Ethlyn
intro.line: I'm going with Quan, Sigurd. Don't worry, though. We'll be back before you know it! Take care of yourself.

intro.speaker: Finn
intro.line: By your leave, sir, I'll be departing with my lord. Thank you for all you've done for us. Don't give up, sir. One day, I know, the charges against you will be cleared and your good name restored. I know you can do this.

intro.speaker: Sigurd
intro.line: Thank you. You've got quite the journey back to Leonster ahead of you. I wish I could do more to help you on your way. May your journey be a safe one!

intro.speaker: Maios
intro.line: Díthorba! Is the army ready to deploy yet?

intro.speaker: Díthorba
intro.line: Yes, sir. Bishop Cuvuli's wind mage unit has infiltrated the forests near Sailane. They await your command, sir.

intro.speaker: Maios
intro.line: Very well. Relay my orders to Cuvuli: move in on Sailane! Díthorba, I trust your pegasus corps are already briefed on your mission?

intro.speaker: Díthorba
intro.line: Yes, sir. Our task is clear. My squadron is to raid the enemy from above, disrupting their tactics.

intro.speaker: Maios
intro.line: Good. Now get to work! Grannvale will owe us a handsome reward for bringing them the heads of their infamous traitors! Heh heh heh…

battle.speaker: Lewyn
battle.line: Mother! You're not hurt, are you? When I heard that Silesse had fallen, I... I was pretty worried there.

battle.speaker: Rahna
battle.line: Thank you so much for coming, Lewyn. Perhaps at last, you've matured into a young man who honors his promises. Perhaps Lord Sigurd has had quite the positive influence on you after all.

battle.speaker: Lewyn
battle.line: Oh, come on, Mother! You don't need to act like I'm still a child. Besides, Sigurd is hardly all that much older than I am.

battle.speaker: Rahna
battle.line: Dear, compared to the likes of Lord Sigurd, you may as well still be a screaming infant. You've still much to learn from him, and quickly. Nothing would be more reassuring than having a son as fine as he by my side. Especially now that Annand is... Oh...

battle.speaker: Lewyn
battle.line: Annand... I should've been the one to die out there. Not her. If only I'd gotten here sooner! Mother, I'll be here to protect you from now on. I won't let Annand's death go to waste. I swear, I will never, ever leave you again.

battle.speaker: Rahna
battle.line: Oh, Lewyn... I never thought you were capable of saying anything so kind. But your word is more than enough. For now, at least, I believe you should remain at Lord Sigurd's side. He has a greater need of your strength.

battle.speaker: Lewyn
battle.line: But if I do that, what about you...?

battle.speaker: Rahna
battle.line: There's nothing to worry about, Lewyn. You are the heir of the wind crusader. Your place is with the rest of the world, to lead and guide it on its true path. The time has come for me to confer upon you your true birthright... The exalted wind tome, Forseti. Here, Lewyn. It's yours.

battle.speaker: Lewyn
battle.line: This... So this is the royal family's ancestral tome... The Book of Forseti... Oh! This power... What's this... warmth?

battle.speaker: Rahna
battle.line: Lewyn, never forget: the Wind Crusader flows as the gentlest breeze. His way is to guide all the peoples of the world on the path of peace. Hate and violence is never his answer.

battle.speaker: Lewyn
battle.line: Yes, of course. I don't think I could live my life any other way.

battle.speaker: Rahna
battle.line: Indeed. Perhaps you truly are a child of the wind... Lewyn... It's time for you to go. Take care out there, and... And don't do anything too rash.

battle.speaker: Lewyn
battle.line: Okay, mother please take care of yourself.

battle.speaker: Young Woman
battle.line: Ah! Are you here to help me? I couldn't possibly thank you enough!

battle.speaker: Young Man
battle.line: Oh! You're here to save me? Thank you so, so much!

end.speaker: Rahna
end.line: Lord Sigurd, that was quite the fierce battle, wasn't it? Are you unharmed?

end.speaker: Rahna
end.line: I know I've asked so much of you already, Lord Sigurd, but would you and your army please station yourselves here at Zaxon? Grannvale's Lord Langbalt has already swept in with an immense army and conquered Lubeck Castle, to our east. The people of Silesse are terrified that this will prove to be but a prelude to a full-scale war with Grannvale.

end.speaker: Sigurd
end.line: Your Highness, I believe Langbalt's army is here only for me. I've no desire to needlessly endanger you or your citizens, after all you've done for us. My men and I are leaving. Now. I have a score to settle with Langbalt.

end.speaker: Rahna
end.line: What recklessness! How could you possibly prevail like this?

end.speaker: Sigurd
end.line: They're coming for me no matter what. If we remain here, then they'll just invade. We can't afford to waste time debating this.

end.speaker: Sigurd
end.line: Your Highness... Thank you so much. You've given me the most wonderful year here, and you've done so much to put my mind at ease. My mother died when I was still very young, so as I grew up, I never knew the unconditional love of a mother.. But thanks to you, here in Silesse, I've come to know that very same warmth. You're like a second mother to me now... Take care of yourself, Your Highness. I hope that someday, once this is all over, we'll have a chance to meet again.

end.speaker: Rahna
end.line: As do I, Lord Sigurd. Please, stay vigilant out there, and keep yourself safe. From the bottom of my heart, I pray that you and Deirdre will soon be reunited.

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: Magic is governed by a hierarchy of power, just like weapons. Fire magic bests wind, wind bests thunder, and thunder bests fire. However, dark and light magic have an advantage over all of the others. Think your strategies through with care.

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: Bein' of holy ancestry can bestow a number of powers onto ya. Divine heirs can wield even the most advanced weapons with ease, and'll have an easier time growin' stronger. 'Course, it's not every day you meet someone blessed with that sorta blood.

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: The Silesse royal family wields the power of wind, as bestowed by the wind god, Forseti. House Velthomer wields the power of fire, as bestowed by the fire goddess, Vala. And House Friege wields thunder powers, as bestowed by the thunder god, Tordo.

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: The sinister powers of the dark god Loptyr can be fought only with the glorious powers of Naga, our great god. Only Grannvale's House Belhalla, the heirs to Saint Heim, inherit Naga's power.

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: Only a direct holy descendant can inherit the full breadth of the power of the gods. And only they'll be able to wield their family's divine heirlooms. However, if kin intersect, their offspring'll have their exalted blood enriched and'll reap almighty powers. Needless to say, mind, doin' that is condemned and forbidden…

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: Should Prince Kurth's daughter bear a son, that son would be heir to Grannvale's throne. I daresay this makes Lord Arvis, husband to the princess, quite the influential figure.

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: Legend has it that all direct heirs to the Crusaders bear exalted brands on their bodies, which appear on them in their infancy. Prince Kurth's daughter has her Naga brand on her forehead. Actually, that was how they recognized her as a direct heiress to Saint Heim.

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: Oh! Lord Sigurd's army is here to save us all! Hang on... Aren't you a dancer, miss? If you don't mind, perhaps you could do a little dance for us? It's been so long since we've had time for respite or fun...

visit.speaker: Silvia
visit.line: Yep not a problem! If you think it'll help everyone cheer up a bit, then I'm gonna dance my feet off! ...Okay! Heeeere we go!

visit.speaker: Silvia
visit.line: Whew... Well, how 'bout that? Everyone feelin' a little better?

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: Oh! What fantastic dancin'! I dunno how, but now I feel like I'm ready to give life my all! I can't thank you enough, miss. Here, perhaps this magic sword'll help ya out. It oughta do a fine job of keeping ya safe.

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: Y'know how there's a drawbridge over the Thove River? Yeah, that's under the control of Duke Maios, too. If it's still drawn and you don't have the key, you're not getting across. Mind you, if you have a thief's sticky fingers at your service, that might not be a problem…

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: What's that? You got the drawbridge lowered? How'd ya know to do that?

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: I'm so sorry I dragged you into this mess as well, Father Claude.

battle-talk.speaker: Claude
battle-talk.line: It's fine. If anything, I'm sorry that my efforts to aid you simply weren't enough. I did return to Grannvale, and I was about to relate the truth to His Majesty. But Reptor interfered before I could do anything, and now I, too, am branded a traitor to the motherland.

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Ugh. I've had enough of just sitting here and letting Reptor have his sorry way! I swear, I've half a mind to storm straight into Grannvale and end this once and for all!

battle-talk.speaker: Claude
battle-talk.line: No. You know better than to rely on brute force or risk the common folk's safety. For now, Lord Sigurd, we must endure.

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: But, Father Claude-

battle-talk.speaker: Claude
battle-talk.line: Make no mistake. I feel your pain, too, but this crisis's end now lies in fate's hands. There is nothing any of us can do to save ourselves anymore.

battle-talk.speaker: Tailtiu
battle-talk.line: Hey, Azelle? Wait up a sec.

battle-talk.speaker: Azelle
battle-talk.line: Tailtiu? Is something wrong?

battle-talk.speaker: Tailtiu
battle-talk.line: I need to ask you something quick.

battle-talk.speaker: Azelle
battle-talk.line: Hm? Me?

battle-talk.speaker: Tailtiu
battle-talk.line: Yeah. That okay? I mean, we've been friends for years. And I don't think there's anyone else who I can ask about this.

battle-talk.speaker: Azelle
battle-talk.line: Huh. You look downright grim and serious... If you really think I can help, then sure. What seems to be the problem?

battle-talk.speaker: Tailtiu
battle-talk.line: Well... I, er... I'm only with you lot because I was just following Claud around, but I'm starting to think I shouldn't have done that...

battle-talk.speaker: Azelle
battle-talk.line: What makes you think so?

battle-talk.speaker: Tailtiu
battle-talk.line: It's because people are acting kinda like they're treading carefully 'round me. And when I'm around, people stop talking about my father...

battle-talk.speaker: Azelle
battle-talk.line: Ah... That certainly doesn't sound fun. But I'd say people really do like you. It's more that they honestly aren't sure how they should treat you, and that they're worried they'll cause you grief. Don't worry too much. It'll all be fine once they get to know you better.

battle-talk.speaker: Tailtiu
battle-talk.line: Yeah... Guess you're right. Thanks, Azelle. Think I might be feeling a bit better 'bout this now.

battle-talk.speaker: Azelle
battle-talk.line: Hah! Glad you're back to normal, Tailtiu. If you're ever feeling like this again, I'll always be here to help you through it, no matter what happens.

battle-talk.speaker: Tailtiu
battle-talk.line: Okay. Thanks!

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: Take care of yourself out here, Azelle.

battle-talk.speaker: Azelle
battle-talk.line: Right. And you as well, Aideen.

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: This still feels so odd... Not once did I ever think that one day we would be together like this.

battle-talk.speaker: Azelle
battle-talk.line: It's because I'm younger than you, right?

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: Oh, no. I'm still not sure why...

battle-talk.speaker: Azelle
battle-talk.line: I still can't quite believe it, either! That you're now my wife... It all still feels like I'm living in some kind of dream!

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: Hm? How so? Don't you believe our marriage feels right?

battle-talk.speaker: Azelle
battle-talk.line: It's not that. It's because, er... Well, you're so beautiful... Even though I was still very young, when I saw you for the first time years ago, my heart just wouldn't stop pounding! Ever since that day, you were the only one for whom I've ever felt this way.

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: Oh, Azelle...

battle-talk.speaker: Azelle
battle-talk.line: It's still pretty embarrassing to admit... Oh, I almost forgot! This is for you. This is a Rescue staff. You can use it to bring people far away back to your side instantly. I know you'll put it to good use.

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: I'm so happy to be with you, Azelle. I'll always treasure having such a kind and gentle soul as you by my side…

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: Midir, please accept this bow.

battle-talk.speaker: Midir
battle-talk.line: Isn’t this a brave bow? Are you sure you want to give away something so rare?

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: I am. I bought it for you, after all. Silesse’s pegasus knights are a formidable foe to face. With a bow of this caliber in hand, I know you’ll be better prepared to fight them.

battle-talk.speaker: Midir
battle-talk.line: Milady… I still can’t believe this isn’t a dream! I can’t believe we’re actually married... I’ve dreamed of this for so long.

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: I’ve long dreamt of the same myself. I wanted to act upon it for many years, but I couldn’t, even at my loneliest… But.. I think by now you can just call me Aideen. I’ll always look out for you, Midir. I’ll always pray for your safety.

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: Jamke, I’d like for you to have this bow.

battle-talk.speaker: Jamke
battle-talk.line: This is a brave bow, isn’t it… You sure it’s okay for me to take it?

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: Yes. Please, accept it. As formidable as the Silessian pegasus knights are, so long as you have this bow, I know you’ll have the upper hand.

battle-talk.speaker: Jamke
battle-talk.line: Thanks, Aideen. I know I’ll be able to keep you safe with a bow like this. I guess I’ll see you later, once this is all over.

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: Jamke… I’ll be praying for your safety.

battle-talk.speaker: Sylvia
battle-talk.line: Hey! Hey, Erinys! You totally like Lewyn, don't ya? Like, do ya really like him?

battle-talk.speaker: Erinys
battle-talk.line: Huh? I... that's... Er, no. Prince Lewyn is beloved and respected by all the people of Silesse, myself included.

battle-talk.speaker: Sylvia
battle-talk.line: Oh? Okay, then. Then I guess you'd be okay with me and Lewyn getting together, right?

battle-talk.speaker: Erinys
battle-talk.line: Er... Yes. I wouldn't really mind...

battle-talk.speaker: Sylvia
battle-talk.line: Reeeeally? That wouldn't but ya at all?

battle-talk.speaker: Erinys
battle-talk.line: No, I'm sure I'd have no issue. Why do you ask? Am I supposed to object?

battle-talk.speaker: Sylvia
battle-talk.line: I dunno! But if it's all fine by ya, then I guess it's time for me to go work my magic on Lewyn...

battle-talk.speaker: Erinys
battle-talk.line: Er... The thing is, a prospective queen of Silesse ought to possess the same grace and dignity as our Queen Rahna.

battle-talk.speaker: Sylvia
battle-talk.line: Oh, so you're sayin' I'm not cut out for it? How rude!

battle-talk.speaker: Erinys
battle-talk.line: Er, no... That isn't-

battle-talk.speaker: Sylvia
battle-talk.line: Hrmph! Fine then! I'll show you!

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: Hello there, mister Father!

battle-talk.speaker: Claud
battle-talk.line: Hm? And who are you?

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: I'm Silviiiiiiiia!

battle-talk.speaker: Claud
battle-talk.line: Well then, Miss Silvia, how can I help? Have you, perchance, recently run afoul of bandits?

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: What's that?

battle-talk.speaker: Claud
battle-talk.line: Well, er... I'm not sure how to put this... You're wearing nothing but smallclothes.

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: Eh?! Watch your mouth, mister Father! Haven't you seen dancers like me before? This is just a dancer's clothes. It's just like you wearin' your churchy cloak!

battle-talk.speaker: Claud
battle-talk.line: Is that so... Hm. Surely you're chilled to the bone, wearing as little as you are, though?

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: Oh, no! Even 'round here I'm never cold, 'cause my heart's ablaze!

battle-talk.speaker: Claud
battle-talk.line: Is dancing truly so fun for you?

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: Yeah! I just love it!

battle-talk.speaker: Claud
battle-talk.line: Is that so... What of your parents? Do they agree with this career of yours?

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: Actually, I'm an orphan. When I was really little, my master took me in and helped me become a dancer. But he... he was an awful, awful man. He'd always beat me outta nowhere. 'Bout a year ago I couldn't stand any more of it all, so I ran away.

battle-talk.speaker: Claud
battle-talk.line: I see... What a horrible tale. I believe I know your pain. I once had a sister, who would likely be around your age if she's still alive.

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: A sister?

battle-talk.speaker: Claud
battle-talk.line: Yes. Alas, she was abducted while she was still an infant. I've searched for her ever since, but to this day I've yet to find any sign of her.

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: Ohh... I bet she's just like a princess! She's gotta be all pretty and classy... And nothin' like me...

battle-talk.speaker: Claud
battle-talk.line: I disagree. I assure you, I do find you to be utterly charming. In your own way, you possess a unique grace and beauty.

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: Oh... mister Father... really?

battle-talk.speaker: Claud
battle-talk.line: Of course. I could never lie.

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: Th-thank you... Nobody's ever told me somethin' like that... This feels kinda funny somehow... Oh... Oh, great, now I'm cryin'... What is this...?

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Hey, Sigurd? Could I have a word?

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Ah, Lewyn. I'm so sorry about what happened to Annand. I had no idea Jungby's bow knights would get involved in this mess.

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: No, it's not your fault. Just mine... I just haven't been thinking right lately. I should've been here all along, looking after Mother and the country. But nope, I just ran away! That's why Annand died... She just took my place in all this.

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: There's no need to blame yourself. The best you can do now is care for the queen, and ensure that Annand didn't die in vain.

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Yeah, I know. No use pointing out the obvious, huh?

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Very well. Oh, Lewyn, before I forget... Don't forget to go see your mother at the capital as soon as possible. She said it's of the utmost importance!

battle-talk.speaker: Erinys
battle-talk.line: Lord Lewyn...

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: ...Oh, Erinys. I'm so sorry. Forgive me. Please...

battle-talk.speaker: Erinys
battle-talk.line: Oh, you mean about Annand...

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: ...Yeah.

battle-talk.speaker: Erinys
battle-talk.line: Oh, so she... you really did... I'm so sorry. I had no idea.

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Whoa, Erinys! You've got it all wrong. I guess when I was younger, I did sorta have a thing for Annand... But that was then. This is now, and the now is you.

battle-talk.speaker: Erinys
battle-talk.line: C-come again?!

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Erinys, I... I love you…

boss.speaker: Lamia
boss.line: Hah! What a clumsy mistake, trying to fight me!

boss.speaker: Donovan
boss.line: Hahaha! Time for ya to die!

boss.speaker: Annand
boss.line: I'm sorry. I know you're not to blame, but this must be done…
